history.content:
Currently taking 188, 186, 100

188 - Exams are pretty hard, workload/difficulty is light to moderate.

186 - Not too difficult. Projects almost every two weeks. I realize that some people have been saying that the class has been harder this semester due to the new projects, but I personally didn't find it all that difficult. Took 6-14 hrs for each of them. The material is somewhat easy, though I understand that it can be a bit boring/dry.

100 - Weekly HWs. Workload comparable to 61A. It is slightly messy due to being a new class, but it should be better next semester.

Someone feel free to add about 61C. I have heard it has a high workload in terms of the projects, which are definitely tedious.

---------------------

61C: Material is hard(and a LOT of material), homework is okay(pretty easy), projects are nearly continuous and very difficult(Fa17 they allowed us to have partners and it wasn't too bad). High workload class for sure (little less than 61B but the material is a lot more difficult).

children.subject:
Then I suppose you would not recommend 61C with 170 together?

What would be good classes to take with 61C and what would be good with 170?

I do not think I will be taking the AI/ML path (126, 127, 189), as I am not doing well in 70 but I heard 188 might be good with 170.

I'm more interested in 160.

follow up from my experience since it's a little different:

188: homework takes a lot of time, projects are pretty easy, exams are crazy hard. The good thing is the workload is pretty consistent so you can plan for it (unlike the other ones).

186: When I took it, it was pretty easy. It's definitely gotten a lot harder since then and I've heard it's kind of ridiculous right now.

61C: OH MY GOD WHAT HAPPENED? This class did not used to be so bad (heard from friends) but since they switched to RISC-V the workload has seemingly doubled. Projects are super hard with very little support, EXTREMELY time consuming. By far this is the heaviest workload CS class I've taken (2nd heaviest is CS170).

history.content: Can people who are taking CS 61C, 188, 186, and 100 describe the workload/difficulty for each of these courses? I'm interested in hearing from those who are currently taking it, since the difficulty seems to be changing over time (for the worse?)
history.subject: Course Difficulty
